bookinfo.title: BIND 10 Messages Manual

abstract.para: BIND 10 is a Domain Name System (DNS) suite managed by Internet Systems Consortium (ISC). It includes DNS libraries and modular components for controlling authoritative and recursive DNS servers.
This is the messages manual for BIND 10 version &__VERSION__;. The most up-to-date version of this document, along with other documents for BIND 10, can be found at .

bookinfo.releaseinfo: This is the messages manual for BIND 10 version &__VERSION__;.

chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: This document lists each message that can be logged by the programs in the BIND 10 package. Each entry in this manual is of the form: IDENTIFICATION message-text ... where "IDENTIFICATION" is the message identification included in each message logged and "message-text" is the accompanying message text. The "message-text" may include placeholders of the form "%1", "%2" etc.; these parameters are replaced by relevant values when the message is logged.
Each entry is also accompanied by a description giving more information about the circumstances that result in the message being logged.
For information on configuring and using BIND 10 logging, refer to the BIND 10 Guide.

varlistentry.term: ASIODNS_FETCH_COMPLETED upstream fetch to %1(%2) has now completed

listitem.para: A debug message, this records that the upstream fetch (a query made by the resolver on behalf of its client) to the specified address has completed.

varlistentry.term: ASIODNS_FETCH_STOPPED upstream fetch to %1(%2) has been stopped

listitem.para: An external component has requested the halting of an upstream fetch. This is an allowed operation, and the message should only appear if debug is enabled.

varlistentry.term: ASIODNS_OPEN_SOCKET error %1 opening %2 socket to %3(%4)

listitem.para: The asynchronous I/O code encountered an error when trying to open a socket of the specified protocol in order to send a message to the target address. The number of the system error that cause the problem is given in the message.

varlistentry.term: ASIODNS_READ_DATA error %1 reading %2 data from %3(%4)

listitem.para: The asynchronous I/O code encountered an error when trying to read data from the specified address on the given protocol. The number of the system error that cause the problem is given in the message.

varlistentry.term: ASIODNS_READ_TIMEOUT receive timeout while waiting for data from %1(%2)

listitem.para: An upstream fetch from the specified address timed out. This may happen for any number of reasons and is most probably a problem at the remote server or a problem on the network. The message will only appear if debug is enabled.

varlistentry.term: ASIODNS_SEND_DATA error %1 sending data using %2 to %3(%4)

listitem.para: The asynchronous I/O code encountered an error when trying send data to the specified address on the given protocol. The the number of the system error that cause the problem is given in the message.

varlistentry.term: ASIODNS_UNKNOWN_ORIGIN unknown origin for ASIO error code %1 (protocol: %2, address %3)
ASIODNS_UNKNOWN_RESULT unknown result (%1) when IOFetch::stop() was executed for I/O to %2(%3)

listitem.para: An internal error indicating that the termination method of the resolver's upstream fetch class was called with an unknown result code (which is given in the message). Please submit a bug report.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_AXFR_ERROR error handling AXFR request: %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message produced by the authoritative server when it has encountered an error processing an AXFR request. The message gives the reason for the error, and the server will return a SERVFAIL code to the sender.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_AXFR_UDP AXFR query received over UDP

listitem.para: This is a debug message output when the authoritative server has received an AXFR query over UDP. Use of UDP for AXFRs is not permitted by the protocol, so the server will return a FORMERR error to the sender.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_COMMAND_FAILED execution of command channel instruction '%1' failed: %2

listitem.para: Execution of the specified command by the authoritative server failed. The message contains the reason for the failure.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_CONFIG_CHANNEL_CREATED configuration session channel created

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that authoritative server has created the channel to the configuration manager. It is issued during server startup is an indication that the initialization is proceeding normally.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_CONFIG_CHANNEL_ESTABLISHED configuration session channel established

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that authoritative server has established communication the configuration manager over the previously-created channel. It is issued during server startup is an indication that the initialization is proceeding normally.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_CONFIG_CHANNEL_STARTED configuration session channel started

listitem.para: This is a debug message, issued when the authoritative server has posted a request to be notified when new configuration information is available. It is issued during server startup is an indication that the initialization is proceeding normally.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_CONFIG_LOAD_FAIL load of configuration failed: %1

listitem.para: An attempt to configure the server with information from the configuration database during the startup sequence has failed. (The reason for the failure is given in the message.) The server will continue its initialization although it may not be configured in the desired way.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_CONFIG_UPDATE_FAIL update of configuration failed: %1

listitem.para: At attempt to update the configuration the server with information from the configuration database has failed, the reason being given in the message.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_DATA_SOURCE data source database file: %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message produced by the authoritative server when it accesses a datebase data source, listing the file that is being accessed.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_DNS_SERVICES_CREATED DNS services created

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the component that will handling incoming queries for the authoritiative server (DNSServices) has been successfully created. It is issued during server startup is an indication that the initialization is proceeding normally.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_HEADER_PARSE_FAIL unable to parse header in received DNS packet: %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message, generated by the authoritative server when an attempt to parse the header of a received DNS packet has failed. (The reason for the failure is given in the message.) The server will drop the packet.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_LOAD_TSIG loading TSIG keys

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the authoritiative server has requested the keyring holding TSIG keys from the configuration database. It is issued during server startup is an indication that the initialization is proceeding normally.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_LOAD_ZONE loaded zone %1/%2

listitem.para: This debug message is issued during the processing of the 'loadzone' command when the authoritative server has successfully loaded the named zone of the named class.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_MEM_DATASRC_DISABLED memory data source is disabled for class %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message reporting that the authoritative server has discovered that the memory data source is disabled for the given class.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_MEM_DATASRC_ENABLED memory data source is enabled for class %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message reporting that the authoritative server has discovered that the memory data source is enabled for the given class.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_NOTIFY_QUESTIONS invalid number of questions (%1) in incoming NOTIFY

listitem.para: This debug message is logged by the authoritative server when it receives a NOTIFY packet that contains zero or more than one question. (A valid NOTIFY packet contains one question.) The server will return a FORMERR error to the sender.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_NOTIFY_RRTYPE invalid question RR type (%1) in incoming NOTIFY

listitem.para: This debug message is logged by the authoritative server when it receives a NOTIFY packet that an RR type of something other than SOA in the question section. (The RR type received is included in the message.) The server will return a FORMERR error to the sender.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_NO_STATS_SESSION session interface for statistics is not available

listitem.para: The authoritative server had no session with the statistics module at the time it attempted to send it data: the attempt has been abandoned. This could be an error in configuration.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_NO_XFRIN received NOTIFY but XFRIN session is not running

listitem.para: This is a debug message produced by the authoritative server when it receives a NOTIFY packet but the XFRIN process is not running. The packet will be dropped and nothing returned to the sender.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_PACKET_PARSE_ERROR unable to parse received DNS packet: %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message, generated by the authoritative server when an attempt to parse a received DNS packet has failed due to something other than a protocol error. The reason for the failure is given in the message; the server will return a SERVFAIL error code to the sender.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_PACKET_PROTOCOL_ERROR DNS packet protocol error: %1. Returning %2

listitem.para: This is a debug message, generated by the authoritative server when an attempt to parse a received DNS packet has failed due to a protocol error. The reason for the failure is given in the message, as is the error code that will be returned to the sender.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_PACKET_RECEIVED message received:\n%1

listitem.para: This is a debug message output by the authoritative server when it receives a valid DNS packet.

Note: This message includes the packet received, rendered in the form of multiple lines of text. For this reason, it is suggested that this log message not be routed to the syslog file, where the multiple lines could confuse programs that expect a format of one message per line.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_PROCESS_FAIL message processing failure: %1

listitem.para: This message is generated by the authoritative server when it has encountered an internal error whilst processing a received packet: the cause of the error is included in the message.
The server will return a SERVFAIL error code to the sender of the packet. However, this message indicates a potential error in the server. Please open a bug ticket for this issue.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_RECEIVED_COMMAND command '%1' received

listitem.para: This is a debug message issued when the authoritative server has received a command on the command channel.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_RECEIVED_SENDSTATS command 'sendstats' received

listitem.para: This is a debug message issued when the authoritative server has received a command from the statistics module to send it data. The 'sendstats' command is handled differently to other commands, which is why the debug message associated with it has its own code.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_RESPONSE_RECEIVED received response message, ignoring

listitem.para: This is a debug message, this is output if the authoritative server receives a DNS packet with the QR bit set, i.e. a DNS response. The server ignores the packet as it only responds to question packets.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_SEND_ERROR_RESPONSE sending an error response (%1 bytes):\n%2

listitem.para: This is a debug message recording that the authoritative server is sending an error response to the originator of the query. A previous message will have recorded details of the failure.

Note: This message includes the packet sent, rendered in the form of multiple lines of text. For this reason, it is suggested that this log message not be routed to the syslog file, where the multiple lines could confuse programs that expect a format of one message per line.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_SEND_NORMAL_RESPONSE sending an error response (%1 bytes):\n%2

listitem.para: This is a debug message recording that the authoritative server is sending a response to the originator of a query.

Note: This message includes the packet sent, rendered in the form of multiple lines of text. For this reason, it is suggested that this log message not be routed to the syslog file, where the multiple lines could confuse programs that expect a format of one message per line.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_SERVER_CREATED server created

listitem.para: An informational message indicating that the authoritative server process has been created and is initializing. The AUTH_SERVER_STARTED message will be output when initialization has successfully completed and the server starts accepting queries.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_SERVER_FAILED server failed: %1

listitem.para: The authoritative server has encountered a fatal error and is terminating. The reason for the failure is included in the message.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_SERVER_STARTED server started

listitem.para: Initialization of the authoritative server has completed successfully and it is entering the main loop, waiting for queries to arrive.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_SQLITE3 nothing to do for loading sqlite3

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the authoritative server has found that the data source it is loading is an SQLite3 data source, so no further validation is needed.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_STATS_CHANNEL_CREATED STATS session channel created

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the authoritative server has created a channel to the statistics process. It is issued during server startup is an indication that the initialization is proceeding normally.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_STATS_CHANNEL_ESTABLISHED STATS session channel established

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the authoritative server has established communication over the previously created statistics channel. It is issued during server startup is an indication that the initialization is proceeding normally.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_STATS_COMMS communication error in sending statistics data: %1

listitem.para: An error was encountered when the authoritiative server tried to send data to the statistics daemon. The message includes additional information describing the reason for the failure.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_STATS_TIMEOUT timeout while sending statistics data: %1

listitem.para: The authoritative server sent data to the statistics daemon but received no acknowledgement within the specified time. The message includes additional information describing the reason for the failure.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_STATS_TIMER_DISABLED statistics timer has been disabled

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the statistics timer has been disabled in the authoritative server and no statistics information is being produced.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_STATS_TIMER_SET statistics timer set to %1 second(s)

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the statistics timer has been enabled and that the authoritative server will produce statistics data at the specified interval.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_UNSUPPORTED_OPCODE unsupported opcode: %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message, produced when a received DNS packet being processed by the authoritative server has been found to contain an unsupported opcode. (The opcode is included in the message.) The server will return an error code of NOTIMPL to the sender.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_XFRIN_CHANNEL_CREATED XFRIN session channel created

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the authoritative server has created a channel to the XFRIN (Transfer-in) process. It is issued during server startup is an indication that the initialization is proceeding normally.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_XFRIN_CHANNEL_ESTABLISHED XFRIN session channel established

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the authoritative server has established communication over the previously-created channel to the XFRIN (Transfer-in) process. It is issued during server startup is an indication that the initialization is proceeding normally.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_ZONEMGR_COMMS error communicating with zone manager: %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message output during the processing of a NOTIFY request. An error (listed in the message) has been encountered whilst communicating with the zone manager. The NOTIFY request will not be honored.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_ZONEMGR_ERROR received error response from zone manager: %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message output during the processing of a NOTIFY request. The zone manager component has been informed of the request, but has returned an error response (which is included in the message). The NOTIFY request will not be honored.

varlistentry.term: CC_ASYNC_READ_FAILED asynchronous read failed

listitem.para: This marks a low level error, we tried to read data from the message queue daemon asynchronously, but the ASIO library returned an error.

varlistentry.term: CC_CONN_ERROR error connecting to message queue (%1)

listitem.para: It is impossible to reach the message queue daemon for the reason given. It is unlikely there'll be reason for whatever program this currently is to continue running, as the communication with the rest of BIND 10 is vital for the components.

varlistentry.term: CC_DISCONNECT disconnecting from message queue daemon

listitem.para: The library is disconnecting from the message queue daemon. This debug message indicates that the program is trying to shut down gracefully.

varlistentry.term: CC_ESTABLISH trying to establish connection with message queue daemon at %1

listitem.para: This debug message indicates that the command channel library is about to connect to the message queue daemon, which should be listening on the UNIX-domain socket listed in the output.

varlistentry.term: CC_ESTABLISHED successfully connected to message queue daemon

listitem.para: This debug message indicates that the connection was successfully made, this should follow CC_ESTABLISH.

varlistentry.term: CC_GROUP_RECEIVE trying to receive a message

listitem.para: Debug message, noting that a message is expected to come over the command channel.

varlistentry.term: CC_GROUP_RECEIVED message arrived ('%1', '%2')

listitem.para: Debug message, noting that we successfully received a message (its envelope and payload listed). This follows CC_GROUP_RECEIVE, but might happen some time later, depending if we waited for it or just polled.

varlistentry.term: CC_GROUP_SEND sending message '%1' to group '%2'

listitem.para: Debug message, we're about to send a message over the command channel.

varlistentry.term: CC_INVALID_LENGTHS invalid length parameters (%1, %2)

listitem.para: This happens when garbage comes over the command channel or some kind of confusion happens in the program. The data received from the socket make no sense if we interpret it as lengths of message. The first one is total length of message, the second length of the header. The header and it's length (2 bytes) is counted in the total length.

varlistentry.term: CC_LENGTH_NOT_READY length not ready

listitem.para: There should be data representing length of message on the socket, but it is not there.

varlistentry.term: CC_NO_MESSAGE no message ready to be received yet

listitem.para: The program polled for incoming messages, but there was no message waiting. This is a debug message which may happen only after CC_GROUP_RECEIVE.

varlistentry.term: CC_NO_MSGQ unable to connect to message queue (%1)

listitem.para: It isn't possible to connect to the message queue daemon, for reason listed. It is unlikely any program will be able continue without the communication.

varlistentry.term: CC_READ_ERROR error reading data from command channel (%1)

listitem.para: A low level error happened when the library tried to read data from the command channel socket. The reason is listed.

varlistentry.term: CC_READ_EXCEPTION error reading data from command channel (%1)

listitem.para: We received an exception while trying to read data from the command channel socket. The reason is listed.

varlistentry.term: CC_REPLY replying to message from '%1' with '%2'

listitem.para: Debug message, noting we're sending a response to the original message with the given envelope.

varlistentry.term: CC_SET_TIMEOUT setting timeout to %1ms

listitem.para: Debug message. A timeout for which the program is willing to wait for a reply is being set.

varlistentry.term: CC_START_READ starting asynchronous read

listitem.para: Debug message. From now on, when a message (or command) comes, it'll wake the program and the library will automatically pass it over to correct place.

varlistentry.term: CC_SUBSCRIBE subscribing to communication group %1

listitem.para: Debug message. The program wants to receive messages addressed to this group.

varlistentry.term: CC_TIMEOUT timeout reading data from command channel

listitem.para: The program waited too long for data from the command channel (usually when it sent a query to different program and it didn't answer for whatever reason).

varlistentry.term: CC_UNSUBSCRIBE unsubscribing from communication group %1

listitem.para: Debug message. The program no longer wants to receive messages addressed to this group.

varlistentry.term: CC_WRITE_ERROR error writing data to command channel (%1)

listitem.para: A low level error happened when the library tried to write data to the command channel socket.

varlistentry.term: CC_ZERO_LENGTH invalid message length (0)

listitem.para: The library received a message length being zero, which makes no sense, since all messages must contain at least the envelope.

varlistentry.term: CFGMGR_AUTOMATIC_CONFIG_DATABASE_UPDATE Updating configuration database from version %1 to %2

listitem.para: An older version of the configuration database has been found, from which there was an automatic upgrade path to the current version. These changes are now applied, and no action from the administrator is necessary.

varlistentry.term: CFGMGR_CC_SESSION_ERROR Error connecting to command channel: %1

listitem.para: The configuration manager daemon was unable to connect to the messaging system. The most likely cause is that msgq is not running.

varlistentry.term: CFGMGR_DATA_READ_ERROR error reading configuration database from disk: %1

listitem.para: There was a problem reading the persistent configuration data as stored on disk. The file may be corrupted, or it is of a version from where there is no automatic upgrade path. The file needs to be repaired or removed. The configuration manager daemon will now shut down.

varlistentry.term: CFGMGR_IOERROR_WHILE_WRITING_CONFIGURATION Unable to write configuration file; configuration not stored: %1

listitem.para: There was an IO error from the system while the configuration manager was trying to write the configuration database to disk. The specific error is given. The most likely cause is that the directory where the file is stored does not exist, or is not writable. The updated configuration is not stored.

varlistentry.term: CFGMGR_OSERROR_WHILE_WRITING_CONFIGURATION Unable to write configuration file; configuration not stored: %1

listitem.para: There was an OS error from the system while the configuration manager was trying to write the configuration database to disk. The specific error is given. The most likely cause is that the system does not have write access to the configuration database file. The updated configuration is not stored.

varlistentry.term: CFGMGR_STOPPED_BY_KEYBOARD keyboard interrupt, shutting down

listitem.para: There was a keyboard interrupt signal to stop the cfgmgr daemon. The daemon will now shut down.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_CCSESSION_MSG error in CC session message: %1

listitem.para: There was a problem with an incoming message on the command and control channel. The message does not appear to be a valid command, and is missing a required element or contains an unknown data format. This most likely means that another BIND10 module is sending a bad message. The message itself is ignored by this module.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_CCSESSION_MSG_INTERNAL error handling CC session message: %1

listitem.para: There was an internal problem handling an incoming message on the command and control channel. An unexpected exception was thrown, details of which are appended to the message. The module will continue to run, but will not send back an answer.
The most likely cause of this error is a programming error. Please raise a bug report.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_GET_FAIL error getting configuration from cfgmgr: %1

listitem.para: The configuration manager returned an error when this module requested the configuration. The full error message answer from the configuration manager is appended to the log error. The most likely cause is that the module is of a different (command specification) version than the running configuration manager.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_JSON_PARSE JSON parse error in %1: %2

listitem.para: There was an error parsing the JSON file. The given file does not appear to be in valid JSON format. Please verify that the filename is correct and that the contents are valid JSON.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_MOD_SPEC_FORMAT module specification error in %1: %2

listitem.para: The given file does not appear to be a valid specification file: details are included in the message. Please verify that the filename is correct and that its contents are a valid BIND10 module specification.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_MOD_SPEC_REJECT module specification rejected by cfgmgr: %1

listitem.para: The specification file for this module was rejected by the configuration manager. The full error message answer from the configuration manager is appended to the log error. The most likely cause is that the module is of a different (specification file) version than the running configuration manager.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_OPEN_FAIL error opening %1: %2

listitem.para: There was an error opening the given file. The reason for the failure is included in the message.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_CREATE creating the hotspot cache

listitem.para: Debug information that the hotspot cache was created at startup.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_DESTROY destroying the hotspot cache

listitem.para: Debug information. The hotspot cache is being destroyed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_DISABLE disabling the cache

listitem.para: The hotspot cache is disabled from now on. It is not going to store information or return anything.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_ENABLE enabling the cache

listitem.para: The hotspot cache is enabled from now on.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_EXPIRED the item '%1' is expired

listitem.para: Debug information. There was an attempt to look up an item in the hotspot cache. And the item was actually there, but it was too old, so it was removed instead and nothing is reported (the external behaviour is the same as with CACHE_NOT_FOUND).

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_FOUND the item '%1' was found

listitem.para: Debug information. An item was successfully looked up in the hotspot cache.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_FULL cache is full, dropping oldest

listitem.para: Debug information. After inserting an item into the hotspot cache, the maximum number of items was exceeded, so the least recently used item will be dropped. This should be directly followed by CACHE_REMOVE.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_INSERT inserting item '%1' into the cache

listitem.para: Debug information. It means a new item is being inserted into the hotspot cache.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_NOT_FOUND the item '%1' was not found

listitem.para: Debug information. It was attempted to look up an item in the hotspot cache, but it is not there.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_OLD_FOUND older instance of cache item found, replacing

listitem.para: Debug information. While inserting an item into the hotspot cache, an older instance of an item with the same name was found. The old instance will be removed. This should be directly followed by CACHE_REMOVE.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_REMOVE removing '%1' from the cache

listitem.para: Debug information. An item is being removed from the hotspot cache.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_SLOTS setting the cache size to '%1', dropping '%2' items

listitem.para: The maximum allowed number of items of the hotspot cache is set to the given number. If there are too many, some of them will be dropped. The size of 0 means no limit.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DO_QUERY handling query for '%1/%2'

listitem.para: Debug information. We're processing some internal query for given name and type.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_ADD_RRSET adding RRset '%1/%2' into zone '%3'

listitem.para: Debug information. An RRset is being added to the in-memory data source.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_ADD_WILDCARD adding wildcards for '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. Some special marks above each * in wildcard name are needed. They are being added now for this name.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_ADD_ZONE adding zone '%1/%2'

listitem.para: Debug information. A zone is being added into the in-memory data source.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_ANY_SUCCESS ANY query for '%1' successful

listitem.para: Debug information. The domain was found and an ANY type query is being answered by providing everything found inside the domain.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_CNAME CNAME at the domain '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. The requested domain is an alias to a different domain, returning the CNAME instead.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_CNAME_COEXIST can't add data to CNAME in domain '%1'

listitem.para: This is the same problem as in MEM_CNAME_TO_NONEMPTY, but it happened the other way around -- adding some other data to CNAME.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_CNAME_TO_NONEMPTY can't add CNAME to domain with other data in '%1'

listitem.para: Someone or something tried to add a CNAME into a domain that already contains some other data. But the protocol forbids coexistence of CNAME with anything (RFC 1034, section 3.6.2). This indicates a problem with provided data.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_CREATE creating zone '%1' in '%2' class

listitem.para: Debug information. A representation of a zone for the in-memory data source is being created.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_DELEG_FOUND delegation found at '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. A delegation point was found above the requested record.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_DESTROY destroying zone '%1' in '%2' class

listitem.para: Debug information. A zone from in-memory data source is being destroyed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_DNAME_ENCOUNTERED encountered a DNAME

listitem.para: Debug information. While searching for the requested domain, a DNAME was encountered on the way. This may lead to redirection to a different domain and stop the search.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_DNAME_FOUND DNAME found at '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. A DNAME was found instead of the requested information.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_DNAME_NS DNAME and NS can't coexist in non-apex domain '%1'

listitem.para: It was requested for DNAME and NS records to be put into the same domain which is not the apex (the top of the zone). This is forbidden by RFC 2672, section 3. This indicates a problem with provided data.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_DOMAIN_EMPTY requested domain '%1' is empty

listitem.para: Debug information. The requested domain exists in the tree of domains, but it is empty. Therefore it doesn't contain the requested resource type.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_DUP_RRSET duplicate RRset '%1/%2'

listitem.para: An RRset is being inserted into in-memory data source for a second time. The original version must be removed first. Note that loading master files where an RRset is split into multiple locations is not supported yet.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_EXACT_DELEGATION delegation at the exact domain '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. There's a NS record at the requested domain. This means this zone is not authoritative for the requested domain, but a delegation should be followed. The requested domain is an apex of some zone.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_FIND find '%1/%2'

listitem.para: Debug information. A search for the requested RRset is being started.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_FIND_ZONE looking for zone '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. A zone object for this zone is being searched for in the in-memory data source.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_LOAD loading zone '%1' from file '%2'

listitem.para: Debug information. The content of master file is being loaded into the memory.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_NOTFOUND requested domain '%1' not found

listitem.para: Debug information. The requested domain does not exist.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_NS_ENCOUNTERED encountered a NS

listitem.para: Debug information. While searching for the requested domain, a NS was encountered on the way (a delegation). This may lead to stop of the search.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_NXRRSET no such type '%1' at '%2'

listitem.para: Debug information. The domain exists, but it doesn't hold any record of the requested type.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_OUT_OF_ZONE domain '%1' doesn't belong to zone '%2'

listitem.para: It was attempted to add the domain into a zone that shouldn't have it (eg. the domain is not subdomain of the zone origin). This indicates a problem with provided data.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_RENAME renaming RRset from '%1' to '%2'

listitem.para: Debug information. A RRset is being generated from a different RRset (most probably a wildcard). So it must be renamed to whatever the user asked for. In fact, it's impossible to rename RRsets with our libraries, so a new one is created and all resource records are copied over.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_SINGLETON trying to add multiple RRs for domain '%1' and type '%2'

listitem.para: Some resource types are singletons -- only one is allowed in a domain (for example CNAME or SOA). This indicates a problem with provided data.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_SUCCESS query for '%1/%2' successful

listitem.para: Debug information. The requested record was found.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_SUPER_STOP stopped at superdomain '%1', domain '%2' is empty

listitem.para: Debug information. The search stopped at a superdomain of the requested domain. The domain is a empty nonterminal, therefore it is treated as NXRRSET case (eg. the domain exists, but it doesn't have the requested record type).

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_SWAP swapping contents of two zone representations ('%1' and '%2')

listitem.para: Debug information. The contents of two in-memory zones are being exchanged. This is usual practice to do some manipulation in exception-safe manner -- the new data are prepared in a different zone object and when it works, they are swapped. The old one contains the new data and the other one can be safely destroyed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_WILDCARD_CANCEL wildcard match canceled for '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. A domain above wildcard was reached, but there's something below the requested domain. Therefore the wildcard doesn't apply here. This behaviour is specified by RFC 1034, section 4.3.3

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_WILDCARD_DNAME DNAME record in wildcard domain '%1'

listitem.para: The software refuses to load DNAME records into a wildcard domain. It isn't explicitly forbidden, but the protocol is ambiguous about how this should behave and BIND 9 refuses that as well. Please describe your intention using different tools.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_WILDCARD_NS NS record in wildcard domain '%1'

listitem.para: The software refuses to load NS records into a wildcard domain. It isn't explicitly forbidden, but the protocol is ambiguous about how this should behave and BIND 9 refuses that as well. Please describe your intention using different tools.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_META_ADD adding a data source into meta data source

listitem.para: Debug information. Yet another data source is being added into the meta data source. (probably at startup or reconfiguration)

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_META_ADD_CLASS_MISMATCH mismatch between classes '%1' and '%2'

listitem.para: It was attempted to add a data source into a meta data source. But their classes do not match.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_META_REMOVE removing data source from meta data source

listitem.para: Debug information. A data source is being removed from meta data source.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_ADD_NSEC adding NSEC record for '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. A NSEC record covering this zone is being added.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_ADD_NSEC3 adding NSEC3 record of zone '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. A NSEC3 record for the given zone is being added to the response message.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_ADD_RRSET adding RRset '%1/%2' to message

listitem.para: Debug information. An RRset is being added to the response message.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_ADD_SOA adding SOA of '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. A SOA record of the given zone is being added to the authority section of the response message.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_AUTH_FAIL the underlying data source failed with %1

listitem.para: The underlying data source failed to answer the authoritative query. 1 means some error, 2 is not implemented. The data source should have logged the specific error already.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_BAD_REFERRAL bad referral to '%1'

listitem.para: The domain lives in another zone. But it is not possible to generate referral information for it.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_CACHED data for %1/%2 found in cache

listitem.para: Debug information. The requested data were found in the hotspot cache, so no query is sent to the real data source.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_CHECK_CACHE checking cache for '%1/%2'

listitem.para: Debug information. While processing a query, lookup to the hotspot cache is being made.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_COPY_AUTH copying authoritative section into message

listitem.para: Debug information. The whole referral information is being copied into the response message.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_DELEGATION looking for delegation on the path to '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. The software is trying to identify delegation points on the way down to the given domain.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_EMPTY_CNAME CNAME at '%1' is empty

listitem.para: There was an CNAME and it was being followed. But it contains no records, so there's nowhere to go. There will be no answer. This indicates a problem with supplied data. We tried to follow

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_EMPTY_DNAME the DNAME on '%1' is empty

listitem.para: During an attempt to synthesize CNAME from this DNAME it was discovered the DNAME is empty (it has no records). This indicates problem with supplied data.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_FAIL query failed

listitem.para: Some subtask of query processing failed. The reason should have been reported already. We are returning SERVFAIL.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_FOLLOW_CNAME following CNAME at '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. The domain is a CNAME (or a DNAME and we created a CNAME for it already), so it's being followed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_GET_MX_ADDITIONAL addition of A/AAAA for '%1' requested by MX '%2'

listitem.para: Debug information. While processing a query, a MX record was met. It references the mentioned address, so A/AAAA records for it are looked up and put it into the additional section.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_GET_NS_ADDITIONAL addition of A/AAAA for '%1' requested by NS '%2'

listitem.para: Debug information. While processing a query, a NS record was met. It references the mentioned address, so A/AAAA records for it are looked up and put it into the additional section.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_GLUE_FAIL the underlying data source failed with %1

listitem.para: The underlying data source failed to answer the glue query. 1 means some error, 2 is not implemented. The data source should have logged the specific error already.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_INVALID_OP invalid query operation requested

listitem.para: This indicates a programmer error. The DO_QUERY was called with unknown operation code.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_IS_AUTH auth query (%1/%2)

listitem.para: Debug information. The last DO_QUERY is an auth query.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_IS_GLUE glue query (%1/%2)

listitem.para: Debug information. The last DO_QUERY is query for glue addresses.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_IS_NOGLUE query for non-glue addresses (%1/%2)

listitem.para: Debug information. The last DO_QUERY is query for addresses that are not glue.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_IS_REF query for referral (%1/%2)

listitem.para: Debug information. The last DO_QUERY is query for referral information.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_IS_SIMPLE simple query (%1/%2)

listitem.para: Debug information. The last DO_QUERY is a simple query.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_MISPLACED_TASK task of this type should not be here

listitem.para: This indicates a programming error. A task was found in the internal task queue, but this kind of task wasn't designed to be inside the queue (it should be handled right away, not queued).

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_MISSING_NS missing NS records for '%1'

listitem.para: NS records should have been put into the authority section. However, this zone has none. This indicates problem with provided data.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_MISSING_SOA the zone '%1' has no SOA

listitem.para: The answer should have been a negative one (eg. of nonexistence of something). To do so, a SOA record should be put into the authority section, but the zone does not have one. This indicates problem with provided data.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_NOGLUE_FAIL the underlying data source failed with %1

listitem.para: The underlying data source failed to answer the no-glue query. 1 means some error, 2 is not implemented. The data source should have logged the specific error already.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_NO_CACHE_ANY_AUTH ignoring cache for ANY query (%1/%2 in %3 class)

listitem.para: Debug information. The hotspot cache is ignored for authoritative ANY queries for consistency reasons.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_NO_CACHE_ANY_SIMPLE ignoring cache for ANY query (%1/%2 in %3 class)

listitem.para: Debug information. The hotspot cache is ignored for ANY queries for consistency reasons.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_NO_DS_NSEC there's no DS record in the '%1' zone

listitem.para: An attempt to add a NSEC record into the message failed, because the zone does not have any DS record. This indicates problem with the provided data.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_NO_DS_NSEC3 there's no DS record in the '%1' zone

listitem.para: An attempt to add a NSEC3 record into the message failed, because the zone does not have any DS record. This indicates problem with the provided data.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_NO_ZONE no zone containing '%1' in class '%2'

listitem.para: Lookup of domain failed because the data have no zone that contain the domain. Maybe someone sent a query to the wrong server for some reason.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_PROCESS processing query '%1/%2' in the '%3' class

listitem.para: Debug information. A sure query is being processed now.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_PROVENX_FAIL unable to prove nonexistence of '%1'

listitem.para: The user wants DNSSEC and we discovered the entity doesn't exist (either domain or the record). But there was an error getting NSEC/NSEC3 record to prove the nonexistence.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_REF_FAIL the underlying data source failed with %1

listitem.para: The underlying data source failed to answer the query for referral information. 1 means some error, 2 is not implemented. The data source should have logged the specific error already.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_RRSIG unable to answer RRSIG query

listitem.para: The server is unable to answer a direct query for RRSIG type, but was asked to do so.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_SIMPLE_FAIL the underlying data source failed with %1

listitem.para: The underlying data source failed to answer the simple query. 1 means some error, 2 is not implemented. The data source should have logged the specific error already.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_SYNTH_CNAME synthesizing CNAME from DNAME on '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. While answering a query, a DNAME was met. The DNAME itself will be returned, but along with it a CNAME for clients which don't understand DNAMEs will be synthesized.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_TASK_FAIL task failed with %1

listitem.para: The query subtask failed. The reason should have been reported by the subtask already. The code is 1 for error, 2 for not implemented.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_TOO_MANY_CNAMES CNAME chain limit exceeded at '%1'

listitem.para: A CNAME led to another CNAME and it led to another, and so on. After 16 CNAMEs, the software gave up. Long CNAME chains are discouraged, and this might possibly be a loop as well. Note that some of the CNAMEs might have been synthesized from DNAMEs. This indicates problem with supplied data.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_UNKNOWN_RESULT unknown result of subtask

listitem.para: This indicates a programmer error. The answer of subtask doesn't look like anything known.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_WILDCARD looking for a wildcard covering '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. A direct match wasn't found, so a wildcard covering the domain is being looked for now.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_WILDCARD_FAIL error processing wildcard for '%1'

listitem.para: During an attempt to cover the domain by a wildcard an error happened. The exact kind was hopefully already reported.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_WILDCARD_PROVENX_FAIL unable to prove nonexistence of '%1' (%2)

listitem.para: While processing a wildcard, it wasn't possible to prove nonexistence of the given domain or record. The code is 1 for error and 2 for not implemented.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_QUERY_WILDCARD_REFERRAL unable to find referral info for '%1' (%2)

listitem.para: While processing a wildcard, a referral was met. But it wasn't possible to get enough information for it. The code is 1 for error, 2 for not implemented.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_CLOSE closing SQLite database

listitem.para: Debug information. The SQLite data source is closing the database file.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_CREATE SQLite data source created

listitem.para: Debug information. An instance of SQLite data source is being created.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_DESTROY SQLite data source destroyed

listitem.para: Debug information. An instance of SQLite data source is being destroyed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_ENCLOSURE looking for zone containing '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. The SQLite data source is trying to identify which zone should hold this domain.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_ENCLOSURE_NOTFOUND no zone contains it

listitem.para: Debug information. The last SQLITE_ENCLOSURE query was unsuccessful; there's no such zone in our data.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_FIND looking for RRset '%1/%2'

listitem.para: Debug information. The SQLite data source is looking up a resource record set.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_FINDADDRS looking for A/AAAA addresses for '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. The data source is looking up the addresses for given domain name.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_FINDADDRS_BAD_CLASS class mismatch looking for addresses ('%1' and '%2')

listitem.para: The SQLite data source was looking up A/AAAA addresses, but the data source contains different class than the query was for.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_FINDEXACT looking for exact RRset '%1/%2'

listitem.para: Debug information. The SQLite data source is looking up an exact resource record.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_FINDEXACT_BAD_CLASS class mismatch looking for an RRset ('%1' and '%2')

listitem.para: The SQLite data source was looking up an exact RRset, but the data source contains different class than the query was for.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_FINDREC looking for record '%1/%2'

listitem.para: Debug information. The SQLite data source is looking up records of given name and type in the database.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_FINDREF looking for referral at '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. The SQLite data source is identifying if this domain is a referral and where it goes.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_FINDREF_BAD_CLASS class mismatch looking for referral ('%1' and '%2')

listitem.para: The SQLite data source was trying to identify if there's a referral. But it contains different class than the query was for.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_FIND_BAD_CLASS class mismatch looking for an RRset ('%1' and '%2')

listitem.para: The SQLite data source was looking up an RRset, but the data source contains different class than the query was for.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_FIND_NSEC3 looking for NSEC3 in zone '%1' for hash '%2'

listitem.para: Debug information. We're trying to look up a NSEC3 record in the SQLite data source.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_FIND_NSEC3_NO_ZONE no such zone '%1'

listitem.para: The SQLite data source was asked to provide a NSEC3 record for given zone. But it doesn't contain that zone.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_OPEN opening SQLite database '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. The SQLite data source is loading an SQLite database in the provided file.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_PREVIOUS looking for name previous to '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. We're trying to look up name preceding the supplied one.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_PREVIOUS_NO_ZONE no zone containing '%1'

listitem.para: The SQLite data source tried to identify name preceding this one. But this one is not contained in any zone in the data source.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_SQLITE_SETUP setting up SQLite database

listitem.para: The database for SQLite data source was found empty. It is assumed this is the first run and it is being initialized with current schema. It'll still contain no data, but it will be ready for use.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_STATIC_BAD_CLASS static data source can handle CH only

listitem.para: For some reason, someone asked the static data source a query that is not in the CH class.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_STATIC_CREATE creating the static datasource

listitem.para: Debug information. The static data source (the one holding stuff like version.bind) is being created.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_STATIC_FIND looking for '%1/%2'

listitem.para: Debug information. This resource record set is being looked up in the static data source.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_UNEXPECTED_QUERY_STATE unexpected query state

listitem.para: This indicates a programming error. An internal task of unknown type was generated.

varlistentry.term: LOGIMPL_ABOVE_MAX_DEBUG debug level of %1 is too high and will be set to the maximum of %2

listitem.para: A message from the interface to the underlying logger implementation reporting that the debug level (as set by an internally-created string DEBUGn, where n is an integer, e.g. DEBUG22) is above the maximum allowed value and has been reduced to that value. The appearance of this message may indicate a programming error - please submit a bug report.

varlistentry.term: LOGIMPL_BAD_DEBUG_STRING debug string '%1' has invalid format

listitem.para: A message from the interface to the underlying logger implementation reporting that an internally-created string used to set the debug level is not of the correct format (it should be of the form DEBUGn, where n is an integer, e.g. DEBUG22). The appearance of this message indicates a programming error - please submit a bug report.

varlistentry.term: LOGIMPL_BELOW_MIN_DEBUG debug level of %1 is too low and will be set to the minimum of %2

listitem.para: A message from the interface to the underlying logger implementation reporting that the debug level (as set by an internally-created string DEBUGn, where n is an integer, e.g. DEBUG22) is below the minimum allowed value and has been increased to that value. The appearance of this message may indicate a programming error - please submit a bug report.

varlistentry.term: LOG_BAD_DESTINATION unrecognized log destination: %1

listitem.para: A logger destination value was given that was not recognized. The destination should be one of "console", "file", or "syslog".

varlistentry.term: LOG_BAD_SEVERITY unrecognized log severity: %1

listitem.para: A logger severity value was given that was not recognized. The severity should be one of "DEBUG", "INFO", "WARN", "ERROR", or "FATAL".

varlistentry.term: LOG_BAD_STREAM bad log console output stream: %1

listitem.para: A log console output stream was given that was not recognized. The output stream should be one of "stdout", or "stderr"

varlistentry.term: LOG_DUPLICATE_MESSAGE_ID duplicate message ID (%1) in compiled code

listitem.para: During start-up, BIND10 detected that the given message identification had been defined multiple times in the BIND10 code.
This has no ill-effects other than the possibility that an erronous message may be logged. However, as it is indicative of a programming error, please log a bug report.

varlistentry.term: LOG_DUPLICATE_NAMESPACE line %1: duplicate $NAMESPACE directive found

listitem.para: When reading a message file, more than one $NAMESPACE directive was found. Such a condition is regarded as an error and the read will be abandoned.

varlistentry.term: LOG_INPUT_OPEN_FAIL unable to open message file %1 for input: %2

listitem.para: The program was not able to open the specified input message file for the reason given.

varlistentry.term: LOG_INVALID_MESSAGE_ID line %1: invalid message identification '%2'

listitem.para: An invalid message identification (ID) has been found during the read of a message file. Message IDs should comprise only alphanumeric characters and the underscore, and should not start with a digit.

varlistentry.term: LOG_NAMESPACE_EXTRA_ARGS line %1: $NAMESPACE directive has too many arguments

listitem.para: The $NAMESPACE directive in a message file takes a single argument, a namespace in which all the generated symbol names are placed. This error is generated when the compiler finds a $NAMESPACE directive with more than one argument.

varlistentry.term: LOG_NAMESPACE_INVALID_ARG line %1: $NAMESPACE directive has an invalid argument ('%2')

listitem.para: The $NAMESPACE argument in a message file should be a valid C++ namespace. This message is output if the simple check on the syntax of the string carried out by the reader fails.

varlistentry.term: LOG_NAMESPACE_NO_ARGS line %1: no arguments were given to the $NAMESPACE directive

listitem.para: The $NAMESPACE directive in a message file takes a single argument, a C++ namespace in which all the generated symbol names are placed. This error is generated when the compiler finds a $NAMESPACE directive with no arguments.

varlistentry.term: LOG_NO_MESSAGE_ID line %1: message definition line found without a message ID

listitem.para: Within a message file, message are defined by lines starting with a "%". The rest of the line should comprise the message ID and text describing the message. This error indicates the message compiler found a line in the message file comprising just the "%" and nothing else.

varlistentry.term: LOG_NO_MESSAGE_TEXT line %1: line found containing a message ID ('%2') and no text

listitem.para: Within a message file, message are defined by lines starting with a "%". The rest of the line should comprise the message ID and text describing the message. This error indicates the message compiler found a line in the message file comprising just the "%" and message identification, but no text.

varlistentry.term: LOG_NO_SUCH_MESSAGE could not replace message text for '%1': no such message

listitem.para: During start-up a local message file was read. A line with the listed message identification was found in the file, but the identification is not one contained in the compiled-in message dictionary. This message may appear a number of times in the file, once for every such unknown message identification.
There may be several reasons why this message may appear:
- The message ID has been mis-spelled in the local message file.
- The program outputting the message may not use that particular message (e.g. it originates in a module not used by the program.)
- The local file was written for an earlier version of the BIND10 software and the later version no longer generates that message.
Whatever the reason, there is no impact on the operation of BIND10.

varlistentry.term: LOG_OPEN_OUTPUT_FAIL unable to open %1 for output: %2

listitem.para: Originating within the logging code, the program was not able to open the specified output file for the reason given.

varlistentry.term: LOG_PREFIX_EXTRA_ARGS line %1: $PREFIX directive has too many arguments

listitem.para: Within a message file, the $PREFIX directive takes a single argument, a prefix to be added to the symbol names when a C++ file is created. This error is generated when the compiler finds a $PREFIX directive with more than one argument.
Note: the $PREFIX directive is deprecated and will be removed in a future version of BIND10.

varlistentry.term: LOG_PREFIX_INVALID_ARG line %1: $PREFIX directive has an invalid argument ('%2')

listitem.para: Within a message file, the $PREFIX directive takes a single argument, a prefix to be added to the symbol names when a C++ file is created. As such, it must adhere to restrictions on C++ symbol names (e.g. may only contain alphanumeric characters or underscores, and may nor start with a digit). A $PREFIX directive was found with an argument (given in the message) that violates those restictions.
Note: the $PREFIX directive is deprecated and will be removed in a future version of BIND10.

varlistentry.term: LOG_READING_LOCAL_FILE reading local message file %1

listitem.para: This is an informational message output by BIND10 when it starts to read a local message file. (A local message file may replace the text of one of more messages; the ID of the message will not be changed though.)

varlistentry.term: LOG_READ_ERROR error reading from message file %1: %2

listitem.para: The specified error was encountered reading from the named message file.

varlistentry.term: LOG_UNRECOGNISED_DIRECTIVE line %1: unrecognised directive '%2'

listitem.para: Within a message file, a line starting with a dollar symbol was found (indicating the presence of a directive) but the first word on the line (shown in the message) was not recognised.

varlistentry.term: LOG_WRITE_ERROR error writing to %1: %2

listitem.para: The specified error was encountered by the message compiler when writing to the named output file.

varlistentry.term: NSAS_FIND_NS_ADDRESS asking resolver to obtain A and AAAA records for %1

listitem.para: A debug message issued when the NSAS (nameserver address store - part of the resolver) is making a callback into the resolver to retrieve the address records for the specified nameserver.

varlistentry.term: NSAS_FOUND_ADDRESS found address %1 for %2

listitem.para: A debug message issued when the NSAS (nameserver address store - part of the resolver) has retrieved the given address for the specified nameserver through an external query.

varlistentry.term: NSAS_INVALID_RESPONSE queried for %1 but got invalid response

listitem.para: The NSAS (nameserver address store - part of the resolver) made a query for a RR for the specified nameserver but received an invalid response. Either the success function was called without a DNS message or the message was invalid on some way. (In the latter case, the error should have been picked up elsewhere in the processing logic, hence the raising of the error here.)
This message indicates an internal error in the NSAS. Please raise a bug report.

varlistentry.term: NSAS_LOOKUP_CANCEL lookup for zone %1 has been canceled

listitem.para: A debug message issued when an NSAS (nameserver address store - part of the resolver) lookup for a zone has been canceled.

varlistentry.term: NSAS_NS_LOOKUP_FAIL failed to lookup any %1 for %2

listitem.para: A debug message issued when the NSAS (nameserver address store - part of the resolver) has been unable to retrieve the specified resource record for the specified nameserver. This is not necessarily a problem - the nameserver may be unreachable, in which case the NSAS will try other nameservers in the zone.

varlistentry.term: NSAS_SEARCH_ZONE_NS searching NSAS for nameservers for zone %1

listitem.para: A debug message output when a call is made to the NSAS (nameserver address store - part of the resolver) to obtain the nameservers for the specified zone.

varlistentry.term: NSAS_UPDATE_RTT update RTT for %1: was %2 ms, is now %3 ms

listitem.para: A NSAS (nameserver address store - part of the resolver) debug message reporting the update of a round-trip time (RTT) for a query made to the specified nameserver. The RTT has been updated using the value given and the new RTT is displayed. (The RTT is subject to a calculation that damps out sudden changes. As a result, the new RTT used by the NSAS in future decisions of which nameserver to use is not necessarily equal to the RTT reported.)

varlistentry.term: NSAS_WRONG_ANSWER queried for %1 RR of type/class %2/%3, received response %4/%5

listitem.para: A NSAS (nameserver address store - part of the resolver) made a query for a resource record of a particular type and class, but instead received an answer with a different given type and class.
This message indicates an internal error in the NSAS. Please raise a bug report.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_ANSWER answer received in response to query for <%1>

listitem.para: A debug message recording that an answer has been received to an upstream query for the specified question. Previous debug messages will have indicated the server to which the question was sent.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_CNAME CNAME received in response to query for <%1>

listitem.para: A debug message recording that CNAME response has been received to an upstream query for the specified question. Previous debug messages will have indicated the server to which the question was sent.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_DEEPEST did not find <%1> in cache, deepest delegation found is %2

listitem.para: A debug message, a cache lookup did not find the specified <name, class, type> tuple in the cache; instead, the deepest delegation found is indicated.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_FOLLOW_CNAME following CNAME chain to <%1>

listitem.para: A debug message, a CNAME response was received and another query is being issued for the <name, class, type> tuple.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_LONG_CHAIN CNAME received in response to query for <%1>: CNAME chain length exceeded

listitem.para: A debug message recording that a CNAME response has been received to an upstream query for the specified question (Previous debug messages will have indicated the server to which the question was sent). However, receipt of this CNAME has meant that the resolver has exceeded the CNAME chain limit (a CNAME chain is where on CNAME points to another) and so an error is being returned.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_NO_NS_RRSET no NS RRSet in referral response received to query for <%1>

listitem.para: A debug message, this indicates that a response was received for the specified query and was categorized as a referral. However, the received message did not contain any NS RRsets. This may indicate a programming error in the response classification code.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_NSAS_LOOKUP looking up nameserver for zone %1 in the NSAS

listitem.para: A debug message, the RunningQuery object is querying the NSAS for the nameservers for the specified zone.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_NXDOM_NXRR NXDOMAIN/NXRRSET received in response to query for <%1>

listitem.para: A debug message recording that either a NXDOMAIN or an NXRRSET response has been received to an upstream query for the specified question. Previous debug messages will have indicated the server to which the question was sent.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_PROTOCOL protocol error in answer for %1: %3

listitem.para: A debug message indicating that a protocol error was received. As there are no retries left, an error will be reported.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_PROTOCOL_RETRY protocol error in answer for %1: %2 (retries left: %3)

listitem.para: A debug message indicating that a protocol error was received and that the resolver is repeating the query to the same nameserver. After this repeated query, there will be the indicated number of retries left.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_RCODE_ERR RCODE indicates error in response to query for <%1>

listitem.para: A debug message, the response to the specified query indicated an error that is not covered by a specific code path. A SERVFAIL will be returned.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_RECQ_CACHE_FIND found <%1> in the cache (resolve() instance %2)

listitem.para: This is a debug message and indicates that a RecursiveQuery object found the the specified <name, class, type> tuple in the cache. The instance number at the end of the message indicates which of the two resolve() methods has been called.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_RECQ_CACHE_NO_FIND did not find <%1> in the cache, starting RunningQuery (resolve() instance %2)

listitem.para: This is a debug message and indicates that the look in the cache made by the RecursiveQuery::resolve() method did not find an answer, so a new RunningQuery object has been created to resolve the question. The instance number at the end of the message indicates which of the two resolve() methods has been called.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_REFERRAL referral received in response to query for <%1>

listitem.para: A debug message recording that a referral response has been received to an upstream query for the specified question. Previous debug messages will have indicated the server to which the question was sent.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_REFER_ZONE referred to zone %1

listitem.para: A debug message indicating that the last referral message was to the specified zone.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_RESOLVE asked to resolve <%1> (resolve() instance %2)

listitem.para: A debug message, the RecursiveQuery::resolve method has been called to resolve the specified <name, class, type> tuple. The first action will be to lookup the specified tuple in the cache. The instance number at the end of the message indicates which of the two resolve() methods has been called.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_RRSET_FOUND found single RRset in the cache when querying for <%1> (resolve() instance %2)

listitem.para: A debug message, indicating that when RecursiveQuery::resolve queried the cache, a single RRset was found which was put in the answer. The instance number at the end of the message indicates which of the two resolve() methods has been called.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_RTT round-trip time of last query calculated as %1 ms

listitem.para: A debug message giving the round-trip time of the last query and response.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_RUNQ_CACHE_FIND found <%1> in the cache

listitem.para: This is a debug message and indicates that a RunningQuery object found the specified <name, class, type> tuple in the cache.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_RUNQ_CACHE_LOOKUP looking up up <%1> in the cache

listitem.para: This is a debug message and indicates that a RunningQuery object has made a call to its doLookup() method to look up the specified <name, class, type> tuple, the first action of which will be to examine the cache.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_RUNQ_FAIL failure callback - nameservers are unreachable

listitem.para: A debug message indicating that a RunningQuery's failure callback has been called because all nameservers for the zone in question are unreachable.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_RUNQ_SUCCESS success callback - sending query to %1

listitem.para: A debug message indicating that a RunningQuery's success callback has been called because a nameserver has been found, and that a query is being sent to the specified nameserver.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_TEST_SERVER setting test server to %1(%2)

listitem.para: This is an internal debugging message and is only generated in unit tests. It indicates that all upstream queries from the resolver are being routed to the specified server, regardless of the address of the nameserver to which the query would normally be routed. As it should never be seen in normal operation, it is a warning message instead of a debug message.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_TEST_UPSTREAM sending upstream query for <%1> to test server at %2

listitem.para: This is a debug message and should only be seen in unit tests. A query for the specified <name, class, type> tuple is being sent to a test nameserver whose address is given in the message.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_TIMEOUT query <%1> to %2 timed out

listitem.para: A debug message indicating that the specified query has timed out and as there are no retries left, an error will be reported.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_TIMEOUT_RETRY query <%1> to %2 timed out, re-trying (retries left: %3)

listitem.para: A debug message indicating that the specified query has timed out and that the resolver is repeating the query to the same nameserver. After this repeated query, there will be the indicated number of retries left.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_TRUNCATED response to query for <%1> was truncated, re-querying over TCP

listitem.para: A debug message, this indicates that the response to the specified query was truncated and that the resolver will be re-querying over TCP. There are various reasons why responses may be truncated, so this message is normal and gives no cause for concern.

varlistentry.term: RESLIB_UPSTREAM sending upstream query for <%1> to %2

listitem.para: A debug message indicating that a query for the specified <name, class, type> tuple is being sent to a nameserver whose address is given in the message.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_AXFR_TCP AXFR request received over TCP

listitem.para: A debug message, the resolver received a NOTIFY message over TCP. The server cannot process it and will return an error message to the sender with the RCODE set to NOTIMP.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_AXFR_UDP AXFR request received over UDP

listitem.para: A debug message, the resolver received a NOTIFY message over UDP. The server cannot process it (and in any case, an AXFR request should be sent over TCP) and will return an error message to the sender with the RCODE set to FORMERR.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_CLIENT_TIME_SMALL client timeout of %1 is too small

listitem.para: An error indicating that the configuration value specified for the query timeout is too small.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_CONFIG_CHANNEL configuration channel created

listitem.para: A debug message, output when the resolver has successfully established a connection to the configuration channel.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_CONFIG_ERROR error in configuration: %1

listitem.para: An error was detected in a configuration update received by the resolver. This may be in the format of the configuration message (in which case this is a programming error) or it may be in the data supplied (in which case it is a user error). The reason for the error, given as a parameter in the message, will give more details.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_CONFIG_LOADED configuration loaded

listitem.para: A debug message, output when the resolver configuration has been successfully loaded.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_CONFIG_UPDATED configuration updated: %1

listitem.para: A debug message, the configuration has been updated with the specified information.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_CREATED main resolver object created

listitem.para: A debug message, output when the Resolver() object has been created.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_DNS_MESSAGE_RECEIVED DNS message received: %1

listitem.para: A debug message, this always precedes some other logging message and is the formatted contents of the DNS packet that the other message refers to.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_DNS_MESSAGE_SENT DNS message of %1 bytes sent: %2

listitem.para: A debug message, this contains details of the response sent back to the querying system.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_FAILED resolver failed, reason: %1

listitem.para: This is an error message output when an unhandled exception is caught by the resolver. All it can do is to shut down.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_FORWARD_ADDRESS setting forward address %1(%2)

listitem.para: This message may appear multiple times during startup, and it lists the forward addresses used by the resolver when running in forwarding mode.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_FORWARD_QUERY processing forward query

listitem.para: The received query has passed all checks and is being forwarded to upstream servers.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_HEADER_ERROR message received, exception when processing header: %1

listitem.para: A debug message noting that an exception occurred during the processing of a received packet. The packet has been dropped.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_IXFR IXFR request received

listitem.para: The resolver received a NOTIFY message over TCP. The server cannot process it and will return an error message to the sender with the RCODE set to NOTIMP.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_LOOKUP_TIME_SMALL lookup timeout of %1 is too small

listitem.para: An error indicating that the configuration value specified for the lookup timeout is too small.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_MESSAGE_ERROR error parsing received message: %1 - returning %2

listitem.para: A debug message noting that the resolver received a message and the parsing of the body of the message failed due to some error (although the parsing of the header succeeded). The message parameters give a textual description of the problem and the RCODE returned.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_NEGATIVE_RETRIES negative number of retries (%1) specified in the configuration

listitem.para: An error message indicating that the resolver configuration has specified a negative retry count. Only zero or positive values are valid.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_NON_IN_PACKET non-IN class request received, returning REFUSED message

listitem.para: A debug message, the resolver has received a DNS packet that was not IN class. The resolver cannot handle such packets, so is returning a REFUSED response to the sender.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_NORMAL_QUERY processing normal query

listitem.para: The received query has passed all checks and is being processed by the resolver.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_NOTIFY_RECEIVED NOTIFY arrived but server is not authoritative

listitem.para: The resolver received a NOTIFY message. As the server is not authoritative it cannot process it, so it returns an error message to the sender with the RCODE set to NOTAUTH.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_NOT_ONE_QUESTION query contained %1 questions, exactly one question was expected

listitem.para: A debug message, the resolver received a query that contained the number of entires in the question section detailed in the message. This is a malformed message, as a DNS query must contain only one question. The resolver will return a message to the sender with the RCODE set to FORMERR.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_NO_ROOT_ADDRESS no root addresses available

listitem.para: A warning message during startup, indicates that no root addresses have been set. This may be because the resolver will get them from a priming query.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_PARSE_ERROR error parsing received message: %1 - returning %2

listitem.para: A debug message noting that the resolver received a message and the parsing of the body of the message failed due to some non-protocol related reason (although the parsing of the header succeeded). The message parameters give a textual description of the problem and the RCODE returned.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_PRINT_COMMAND print message command, arguments are: %1

listitem.para: This message is logged when a "print_message" command is received over the command channel.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_PROTOCOL_ERROR protocol error parsing received message: %1 - returning %2

listitem.para: A debug message noting that the resolver received a message and the parsing of the body of the message failed due to some protocol error (although the parsing of the header succeeded). The message parameters give a textual description of the problem and the RCODE returned.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_QUERY_ACCEPTED query accepted: '%1/%2/%3' from %4

listitem.para: A debug message that indicates an incoming query is accepted in terms of the query ACL. The log message shows the query in the form of <query name>/<query type>/<query class>, and the client that sends the query in the form of <Source IP address>#<source port>.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_QUERY_DROPPED query dropped: '%1/%2/%3' from %4

listitem.para: An informational message that indicates an incoming query is dropped in terms of the query ACL. Unlike the RESOLVER_QUERY_REJECTED case, the server does not return any response. The log message shows the query in the form of <query name>/<query type>/<query class>, and the client that sends the query in the form of <Source IP address>#<source port>.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_QUERY_REJECTED query rejected: '%1/%2/%3' from %4

listitem.para: An informational message that indicates an incoming query is rejected in terms of the query ACL. This results in a response with an RCODE of REFUSED. The log message shows the query in the form of <query name>/<query type>/<query class>, and the client that sends the query in the form of <Source IP address>#<source port>.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_QUERY_SETUP query setup

listitem.para: A debug message noting that the resolver is creating a RecursiveQuery object.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_QUERY_SHUTDOWN query shutdown

listitem.para: A debug message noting that the resolver is destroying a RecursiveQuery object.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_QUERY_TIME_SMALL query timeout of %1 is too small

listitem.para: An error indicating that the configuration value specified for the query timeout is too small.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_RECEIVED_MESSAGE resolver has received a DNS message

listitem.para: A debug message indicating that the resolver has received a message. Depending on the debug settings, subsequent log output will indicate the nature of the message.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_RECURSIVE running in recursive mode

listitem.para: This is an informational message that appears at startup noting that the resolver is running in recursive mode.

varlistentry.term: RESOLVER_SERVICE_CREATED service object created
